Making this blog

In an effort to aid in reproducibility and help future me understand what I did here, I’ve decided to write a little about the way that I made this blog. I used Jekyll, a static-site generator that I’ve used a little in the past, and GitHub Pages. Regarding the formatting, I decided to use Rasmus Andersson’s Inter for the font and his Raster for the layout. I discovered Inter a little bit ago, and I think that it is really a fantastic font for reading things on the web. Raster probably wasn’t necessary, but it makes it quick and easy to make a grid in HTML, and Rasmus included Inter imports and nice default sizes and weights in the full Raster package.

2021-05-26
